result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Aidan Bembenek Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharge.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Comply with same conditions as stated in 15CF194.
May be transferred to Marathon County.

records.addlTxt:
10:36 a.m. Defendant Thomas Aidan Bembenek in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF194, 15CF257, and 15CF359 are heard today.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 Plea to 15CF194 Count 2 and 15CF257.  15CF359 and 15CF194 Counts 1 & 3. W/H Sentence 2yr probation w/conditions.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF194 Count 2 - No Contest
15CF257 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF194 Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CF359 and 15CF194 Counts 1 & 3 are Dismissed and Read In

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
15CF194 has 1 day credit and 15CF257 has 2 days credit.
Atty Cveykus concurs with joint recommendation. Already done AODA and is in counseling. 

Defendant makes statements.
BY THE COURT:****PROBATION*****
 15CF194
 W /H  Sentence (1 day credit, if revoked)
  2 yrs  Probation (may be served in Marathon County)
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. 
Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.  
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.  
Pay costs, Drug, DNA surcharge.

15CF257 W /H  Sentence (2 day credit, if revoked)
  2 yrs  Probation, concurrent with 15CF194.
Comply with same conditions as stated in 15CF194.
Pay costs, Drug, DNA surcharge.

15CV182 cash $230 forfeited and $655 returned to Defendant.  Clerk to prepare an order stating so.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

15CF194 & 15CF257 Preliminary Hearing Waivers and Arraignments are heard at this time:
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant Thomas Aidan Bembenek in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus. Elizabeth Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: Preliminary Hearing on 15CF194.  Initial Appearance on 15CF257.
3:05 p.m. Court calls the cases. 

15CF257 Initial Appearance heard at this time: 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 11:45 am.

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Daniel Cveykus appears in Court. 

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Atty Cveykus makes statements to the Court. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests this bond be covered by the bond set in 15CF194.
BY THE COURT:  So ordered. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  7/20/15  @ 3:00 p.m.  in Branch 2 (Matter is tracking with 15CF194.)
